entity.name: Updates on COVID-19 in New Zealand
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with information about the COVID-19 situation from the government, health authorities and other trusted sources across New Zealand. For more, visit https://covid19.govt.nz/.

entity.name: UK still ‘not past’ the coronavirus peak, Foreign Secretary Raab says in briefing
entity.description:
- Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab says government is ‘united in focus’ on coronavirus plans
- Raab also states that the lockdown will not be lifted later this week
- Chief Scientific Adviser Sir Patrick Vallance reports the UK will see an increase in deaths this week followed by a plateau
- Vallance also expects the lockdown to last until mid-May
- The Prime Minister has left the hospital but will not immediately return to work, Downing Street says

text:
“If there was ever a time to close the gap between groups of people across New Zealand in different positions, it is now."

New Zealand's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has said she and her ministers will be taking a 20 per cent pay cut for six months due to the coronavirus crisis https://t.co/G7J6Nd3rNH
